info.title: London Stock Exchange - Native Trading Gateway

sessionMessages.name: Logon
sessionMessages.description: Allows the client and server to establish a session.

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type

fields.name: User Name
fields.description: User Name

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password

fields.name: New Password
fields.description: New Password

fields.name: Message Version
fields.description: Message Version that will be used in this version. The value has to be always 1.

sessionMessages.name: Logon Response
sessionMessages.description: Allows the server to acknowledge a client's Logon.

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Reject Code
fields.description: Code Specifying the reason of the reject. Please refer to the Reject Code Specification of the list of reject codes and meanings specific to London Stock Exchange.

fields.name: PasswordExpiryDayCount
fields.description: The number of days before the password will expire.

sessionMessages.description: Allows the client and server to terminate a session.

fields.name: Message Type

fields.description: Reason of the logout.

sessionMessages.name: Heartbeat
sessionMessages.description: Allows the client and server to exercise the communication line during periods of inactivity and verify that the interfaces at each end are available.

sessionMessages.name: System Status
sessionMessages.description: This message will be disseminated in the recovery channel to indicate Service Non Availability of a partition (due to order cache outage). This message will also be disseminated when the service is resumed.

businessMessages.name: New Order

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the order

fields.name: Trader ID
fields.description: Optional Trader ID that clients may submit

fields.name: Account
fields.description: Optional reference of the investor the order is submitted for.

fields.name: ClearingAccount
fields.description: Clearing Account Type

fields.name: Instrument ID
fields.description: Identifier of the instrument for which the order is submitted.

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use. This will always be 0.

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use. This will always be 0.

fields.name: Order Type
fields.description: Type of the order.

fields.name: TIF
fields.description: Time qualifier of the order.

fields.name: ExpireDateTime
fields.description: This field will indicate the date or the time the order expires on.

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Side of the order.

fields.name: Order Qty
fields.description: Total order quantity.

fields.name: Display Qty
fields.description: Maximum quantity that may be displayed.

fields.name: Limit Price
fields.description: Limit Price. Required if OrderType is Limit or Stop Limit. Else this field will be ignored.

fields.name: Capacity
fields.description: Capacity of the order

fields.name: Auto Cancel
fields.description: Cancel orders on logout/disconnection of session

fields.name: Order Sub Type
fields.description: Whether the order is a pegged order. If the client submits a Pegged Order with a limit price (so called a “Hard Limit”), the Order Type has to be Limit (2) along with Order Sub Type Pegged Order (5). If the client submits a Pegged without a limit price, the Order Type has to be Market (1) along with Order Sub Type Pegged Order (5). If this is populated with value “51” while a value which is greater than 0 and less than the Order Quantity is populated in DisplayQty, the DisplayQty after replenishment will be randomly sized based on a percentage range upwards from the original DisplayQty. The DisplayQty after replenishment will be “fixed peak”.

fields.name: Anonymity
fields.description: Whether the order is a named or anonymous order

fields.name: Stopped Price
fields.description: Stop Price.Required if Order Type is Stop or Stop Limit. Else this field will be ignored.

fields.name: PassiveOnlyOrder
fields.description: Order level parameter to allow clients to specify that they would like their order to rest prior to execution, with flexibility for visible orders to rest at a specified price level on the book. Passive Only Orders will execute against hidden orders sat within the BBO on order entry.Any fully hidden order will be rejected if it has enum 100, 1,2 or 3. No passive only order validation will be done if field is not stamped or has 0 stamped on it.

values.description: Only accept order if setting new BBO or joining existing BBO. Otherwise expire order.
Only accept order if will be at BBO or within one visible price-point. Otherwise expire order
Only accept order if will be at BBO or within two visible price-points. Otherwise expire order
Only accept order if it will not match with visible contra order. Otherwise expire order
Only accept order if setting new visible BBO, otherwise expire order

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use

fields.name: Minimum Quantity
fields.description: Minimum Execution Size (MES) of an order. A value of 0 (zero) means no MES. MES is only valid for pegged orders. If a non zero value is specified for a non-pegged order type the message will be rejected.

businessMessages.name: Order Cancel Request

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the request. It is optional to specify this.

fields.name: Original Client Order ID
fields.description: Client Order ID of the order being amended. This field will be ignored if order ID is also specified.

fields.name: Order ID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the order assigned by the matching engine.

fields.name: Instrument ID
fields.description: Identifer of the instrument of the order being cancelled.

fields.name: Reserved field1
fields.description: This will always be 0

fields.name: Reserved field2
fields.description: This will always be 0

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Side of the order

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use

businessMessages.name: Order Cancel/Replace Request

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the request. It is optional to specify this.

fields.name: Original Client Order ID
fields.description: Client Order ID of the order being amended. This field will be ignored if the Order ID is also specified.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the order assigned by the matching system.

fields.name: Instrument ID
fields.description: Identifier of the instrument of the order being amended.

fields.name: Reserved Field1
fields.description: This will always be 0.

fields.name: Reserved Field2
fields.description: This will always be 0.

fields.name: ExpireDateTime
fields.description: This field will indicate the date or the time the order expires on. It is mandatory to specify a valid value in this field for GTD/GTT orders. If 0 is specified for GTD/GTT orders, the request will be rejected. For non GTD/GTT orders, the value in this field will be ignored.

fields.name: Order Qty
fields.description: Total order quantity.

fields.name: Display Qty
fields.description: Maximum quantity that may be displayed. The intended display quantity has to be inserted as this is mandatory field.

fields.name: Limit Price
fields.description: Only for Market and Stop orders this field should be filled with a negative value

fields.name: Account
fields.description: The reference of the investor the order is submitted for. This field should be null if it is not being amended.

fields.name: TIF
fields.description: Time qualifier of the order being amended.

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Side of the order

fields.name: Stopped Price
fields.description: Stop Price.A negative value should be entered if this field is not being amended. This applies to all order types.

fields.name: PassiveOnlyOrder
fields.description: Order level parameter to allow clients to specify that they would like their order to rest prior to execution, with flexibility for visible orders to rest at a specified price level on the book. Passive Only Orders will execute against hidden orders sat within the BBO on order entry.Any fully hidden order will be rejected if it has enum 100, 1,2 or 3. No passive only order validation will be done if field is not stamped or has 0 stamped on it.The newly amended or old PassiveOnlyOrder indicator stamped on an order amend message will not be evaluated.

values.description: Only accept order if setting new BBO or joining existing BBO. Otherwise expire order.
Only accept order if will be at BBO or within one visible price-point. Otherwise expire order
Only accept order if will be at BBO or within two visible price-points. Otherwise expire order
Only accept order if it will not match with visible contra order. Otherwise expire order
Only accept order if setting new visible BBO, otherwise expire order

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use

fields.name: Minimum Quantity
fields.description: Minimum Execution Size (MES) of an order. A value of 0 (zero) means no MES. MES is only valid for pegged orders. If a non zero value is specified for a non-pegged order type the message will be rejected.

businessMessages.name: Order Mass Cancel Request

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of mass cancel request. It is optional to specify it.

fields.name: MassCancelRequestType
fields.description: Type of the Mass Cancellation

values.description: All firm orders of an instrument
All firm orders of a segment
All orders submitted by the trader
All orders of an instrument, submitted by the trader
All orders of a segment, submitted by the trader.

fields.name: Instrument ID
fields.description: Identifier of the instrument of the orders being cancelled. Required if MassCancelRequestType = 3 or 9. Else will be ignored.

fields.name: Reserved field1
fields.description: This will always be 0

fields.name: Reserved Field2
fields.description: This will always be 0

fields.name: Segment
fields.description: The segment for which the orders will be cancelled. Required of MassCancelRequestType = 4 or 15. Else this field will be ignored.

fields.name: Order Sub Type
fields.description: Whether cancellation should be done an orders or quotes

fields.name: Reserved field
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

businessMessages.name: New Order Cross

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: CrossID
fields.description:
An identifier of the Cross/BTF Order. Required for Cross/BTF Orders.<br />
Must be unique per day but note that the system only validates the uniqueness of the Cross ID with the currently open Committed cross Orders in the container.

fields.name: CrossType
fields.description:
The type of the Cross/BTF Order.<br>
Any other value will be rejected.

fields.name: BuySideClOrdID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the buy side.

fields.name: BuySideOrderCapacity
fields.description: Capacity of the buy side.

fields.name: BuySideClearingAccount
fields.description: Clearing Account Type.

fields.name: BuySideOrderQuantity
fields.description: Total order quantity of the Cross/BTF Order

fields.name: BuySideFirmID
fields.description: Identifier of the Buy Side Firm

fields.name: BuySidePartyRole
fields.description: Role of the specified Firm

fields.name: SellSideClOrdID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the sell side.

fields.name: SellSideOrderCapacity
fields.description: Capacity of the sell side.

fields.name: SellSideClearingAccount
fields.description: Clearing Account Type.

fields.name: SellSideOrderQuantity
fields.description: Total order quantity of the Cross/BTF Order

fields.name: SellSideFirmID
fields.description: Identifier of the Sell Side Firm

fields.name: BuySidePartyRole
fields.description: Role of the specified Firm<br />

fields.name: InstrumentID
fields.description: Identifier of the instrument for which the Cross/BTF Order is submitted.

fields.name: Price
fields.description: Price of the Cross/BTF Order

fields.name: OrderType
fields.description: Type of the Order.

fields.name: TIF

businessMessages.name: Cross Order Cancel Request

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: CrossID
fields.description:
An identifier of the Cancel Request itself.<br />
This field will not be used as the unique identifier of the order being cancelled nor will the value in this field be validated for uniqueness

fields.name: OriginalCrossID
fields.description:
Cross ID of the order being cancelled. This field is mandatory, but will not be used as the unique identifier of the order being cancelled.<br>
The value specified in this will not be validated against the value specified in the New Order Cross Message.

fields.name: CrossType
fields.description:
The value submitted with the Cross/BTF Order to be cancelled.<br />
The value specified in this will not be validated against the value specified in the New Order Cross Message.

fields.name: BuySideClOrdID
fields.description:
The value submitted in the “Buy Side ClOrdID” (in the New Order Cross Message) of the Cross/BTF Order to be cancelled.<br />
This will be a unique identifier of the order being cancelled.

fields.name: BuySideOrderQuantity
fields.description:
The value submitted with the Cross/BTF Order to be cancelled.<br />
The value specified in this will not be validated against the value specified in the New Order Cross Message.

fields.name: SellSideClOrdID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the sell side.

fields.name: SellSideOrderQuantity
fields.description: Total order quantity of the Cross/BTF Order

fields.name: InstrumentID
fields.description:
The value submitted with the Cross/BTF Order to be cancelled.<br />
Any other value will be rejected.

fields.name: ClientOrderID
fields.description: A unique identifier of the cancel request itself. But this field will not be used as the unique identifier of the order being cancelled.

businessMessages.name: Execution Report

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: AppID
fields.description: Partition ID

fields.name: Sequence No
fields.description: Sequence number of the message

fields.name: Execution ID
fields.description: Unique ID of the Execution Report. Unique across all partitions, all days. This will be a 62 base encoded value in ASCII format

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the order.If the execution report is generated as a response to order cancel or order mass cancel request, this will be the client order id specified in the order cancel or order mass cancel request. If a client order id is not specified in the order cancel or order mass cancel request, this will be the original client order id of the order being cancelled.

fields.name: Order ID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the order assigned by the matching system. This will be a 62 base encoded value in ASCII format. By converting this to binary, this can be mapped with ITCH Order ID.

fields.name: Exec Type
fields.description: The reason the Execution Report is being sent.

fields.name: Execution Report Ref ID
fields.description: Reference to the execution being cancelled or corrected. Required if Exec Type is Trade Cancel

fields.name: Order Status
fields.description: The status of the order.

fields.name: Order Reject Code
fields.description: Code specifying the reason for the reject or the expiry. Please refer to the Reject Code Specification for the list of reject codes and meanings specific to LSE. The value in this field should be disregarded if Exec Type is not Rejected (8) except for orders expired (6) due to Self-Execution Prevention validations.(I.e. if an order is expired due to SEP validations, reject code 119200 will be populated with Exec Type= C )

fields.name: Executed Price
fields.description: Value of the fill. Required if Exec Type is Trade

fields.name: Executed Qty
fields.description: Quantity that was executed in this fill.

fields.name: LeavesQty
fields.description: Quantity available for further execution. Will be '0' if Order Status is Filled, Cancelled, Rejected of Expired.

fields.name: Container
fields.description: The container which holds the order in the trading engine.

fields.name: DisplayQty
fields.description: Current visible quantity

fields.name: Instrument ID
fields.description: Identifier of the instrument the Execution Report is sent for.

fields.name: Restatement Reason
fields.description: Reason order was restated or cancelled. Required if ExecType (53) is Restated (D) or if the execution report is sent for an unsolicited cancellation. It should be tagged with a new enum 3 (Order Re_Priced) upon order re-pricing at the start of CPX session Should be tagged with new enum 100 (Order Replenishment) when the order is replenished with the new Public Order ID during the auction call.

fields.name: Reserved field2
fields.description: This will always be 0.

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Side of the order

fields.name: Reserved field
fields.description: Reserved for future use

fields.name: Counterparty
fields.description: Counterparty Firm. If the trade is internalized, the Counterparty Firm will be populated with the user's own Firm ID. If a trade is cleared, the Counterparty Firm will be populated with CCP. If an on book trade is not cleared, the Counterparty Firm (17) will be populated with Contra Party Firm ID.

fields.name: Trade Liquidity Indicator
fields.description: Whether the order added or removed liquidity. The value in this field should only be considered if the Exec Type is Trade (F), or Trade Cancel (H), although it will not be populated for Cross Order trades. For the rest of exec types, the value in this field should be ignored.

fields.name: TradeMatchID
fields.description:
Identifier of the trade. This will be the binary format value of the base 36 encoded trade id in the system. This will be same as MITCH Trade ID.<br />
Also the identifier sent to the clearer.

fields.name: Transact Time
fields.description: Time the Execution Report was generated.

fields.name: Reserved field
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: TypeOfTrade
fields.description: Indicates whether the executed portion is visible or hidden. Valid only if Exec Type (53) = F. Ignore value in all other cases.

fields.name: Capacity
fields.description: Capacity of the order

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: Public Order ID
fields.description: Maintained by matching engine, will be unique for each replenishment of a particular iceberg order. This will be a 62 base encoded value in ASCII format.

fields.name: Minimum Quantity
fields.description: Minimum Execution Size (MES) specified on a pegged order.  Following an execution if the remaining quantity of order < MES specified in the order, Minimum Quantity = Remaining Quantity.  For order types other than pegged this field will always contain 0 (zero).

businessMessages.name: Order Cancel Reject
businessMessages.description: Indicates that an order cancel request or order cancel/replace request has been rejected.

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: AppID
fields.description: Partition ID

fields.name: Sequence No
fields.description: equence Number of the message

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client Order ID that was submitted with the order cancel or cancel/replace request being rejected

fields.name: Order ID
fields.description: Server specified identifier of the order for which the cancel or cancel/replace was submitted. Will be "NONE" if the order is unknown

fields.name: Cancel Reject Reason
fields.description: Code specifying the reason for the reject. Please refer to the Reject Code Specification for the list of reject codes and meanings specific to LSE.

fields.name: Transact Time
fields.description: Time the Order Cancel Reject occured. The first 4 bytes of the Transact Time timestamp will represent the Unix (Posix) time while the next 4 bytes will specify the micro seconds. The Transac Time will be in UTC.

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

businessMessages.name: Mass Cancel Report

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: AppID
fields.description: Partition ID

fields.name: Sequence No
fields.description: Sequence Number of the message

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of mass cancel request

fields.name: MassCancelResponse
fields.description: Whether tne Mass Cancel Request was accepted or rejected

fields.name: MassCancelRejectReason
fields.description: The code that identifies the reason the order mass cancel was rejected. Please refer to the Reject Code Specification for the list of reject codes and meanings specific to LSE.

fields.name: Reserved field
fields.description: Reserved field for future use.

fields.name: Transact Time
fields.description: Time the order mass cancel report was generated. The first 4 bytes of the TransacTime timestamps will represent the Unix (Posix) time while the next 4 bytes will specify the micro seconds. The Transact Time will be in UTC.

fields.name: Reserved filed
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

businessMessages.name: Quote
businessMessages.description: Allows the client to submit and update a quote.

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identified identifier of the quote.

fields.name: Trader ID
fields.description: Optional Trader ID that clients may submit.

fields.name: ClearingAccount
fields.description: Clearing Account Type.

fields.name: Instrument ID
fields.description: Identifier of the instrument for which the quote is submitted

fields.name: BidPrice
fields.description: Bid Price.

fields.name: BidSize
fields.description: Bid Quantity.

fields.name: AskPrice
fields.description: Offer Price.

fields.name: AskSize
fields.description: Offer Quantity.

fields.name: Capacity
fields.description: Capacity of the quote.

fields.name: Auto Cancel
fields.description: Cancel orders on logout/disconnection of session.

fields.name: Reserved Field
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

businessMessages.name: Business Message Reject
businessMessages.description: Indicates that an application message could not be processed

fields.name: Start of Message
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 8 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Length
fields.description: Little-Endian encoded 16 bit signed integer.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: A single byte used to hold hex value

fields.name: AppID
fields.description: Partition ID

fields.name: Sequence No
fields.description: Sequence number of the message.

fields.name: RejectCode
fields.description: Code specifying the reason for the reject. Please refer to the Reject Code Specification for the list of reject codes and meanings specific to LSE.

fields.name: Client Order ID
fields.description: Client specified identifier of the order.

fields.name: Order ID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the order assigned by the matching engine.

fields.name: Transact Time
fields.description: Time the order mass cancel report was generated. The first 4 bytes of the TransactTime timestamp will represent the Unix (Posix) time while the next 4 bytes will specify the micro seconds. The Transact Time will be UTC.

fields.name: Reserved field
fields.description: Reserved for future use.
